instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01521 water damaged
threads.message:
Hello, 
I have 820-01521 water damaged, one USB-C port have 5v 0.3a-0.5a
The other one 5v0 0a
How i could start the diagnostic in this case.
Thanks for your help.

threads.title: 820-01521 water damaged
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings between CD3215 chips; even better if have a good board for comparison.

threads.title: 820-01521 water damaged
threads.message: I Found PP1V8_SLPS2R Shorted with 6.7 when i tried to connect the charger voltage in this line was unstable between 0 and max value was 0.6 V also PP1V1_SLPDDR_SOC was shorted too was 0.3, can it be the T2 chip? and is there anyway i can fix this issue?

threads.title: 820-01521 water damaged
threads.message:
"I Found PP1V8_SLPS2R Shorted with 6.7"
What means 6.7?
Post exact ohm value to ground, not diode mode.

threads.title: 820-01521 water damaged
threads.message:
sorry it's 6.7 ohm
so pp1v1_SLPDDR_SOC 0.3 ohm

threads.title: 820-01521 water damaged
threads.message:
These are really bad values.
You can try to inject 1V to PP1v1_SLPDDR_SOC .
If T2 heats, the board is good for scrap...
